greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse function to Hofstadter's A005228.
comment: This is an inverse function to Hofstadter's A005228 in the sense that for all n, n = a(A005228(n)). a(n) = 0 when n is not in A005228, but instead in its complement A030124.
Note that a(n)*A232749(n) = 0 for all n.
Used to compute the permutation A232751.
xref: A030124 gives the positions of zeros.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 30 2013
